recipe.title: Shepherd's Pie
recipe.description: Comforting British classic with lamb mince and mashed potato

steps.descr: Brown lamb mince, add onion and carrots
steps.instructions: Brown lamb mince, add onion and carrots

on_enter.say: Alright, let's get started by browning the lamb mince. Once it's nice and brown, we'll add in the onion and carrots. You'll know it's ready when the kitchen starts to smell amazing!

steps.descr: Stir in tomato purée and stock, simmer 20 mins
steps.instructions: Stir in tomato purée and stock, simmer 20 mins

on_enter.say: Now, let's stir in the tomato purée and stock. Give it a good mix and then we'll let it simmer for twenty minutes. This is where all those lovely flavors come together!
Let's get those potatoes boiling until they're nice and tender. You want them soft enough to mash easily.

steps.descr: Mash with butter and milk until smooth
steps.instructions: Mash with butter and milk until smooth

on_enter.say: Time to mash those potatoes! Add in the butter and milk, and mash until they're smooth and creamy. This is going to be the perfect topping for our pie.
Now, let's transfer that lovely meat mixture into a baking dish. Make sure to spread it out evenly.

steps.descr: Top with mashed potato, fork patterns on top
steps.instructions: Top with mashed potato, fork patterns on top

on_enter.say: Let's spoon the mashed potato over the meat. Use a fork to create some lovely patterns on top. This will help it crisp up beautifully in the oven.

steps.descr: Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until golden
steps.instructions: Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Alright, let's pop that into the oven at two hundred degrees celsius for twenty-five minutes. We're looking for a beautiful golden top. Can't wait to dig in!

notes.text:
Use beef mince for cottage pie
Add worcestershire sauce for depth
Freeze individual portions for easy meals
